name: GitLive
description:
Extend Git with real-time collaborative superpowers




The future of social coding

Connect. See when your fellow contributors are online and which repos, branches and files they are working on.

Automated. Connect your issue tracker to share what issue you are working on based on your current branch.



Resolve conflicts before they happen

Live. See others' local changes in the gutter of your editor and get notified the moment you make a conflicting change.

Patch. View diffs of other contributors' local files and cherry-pick individual lines, files or complete working copies.



Code together in real-time

Codeshare. Make voice and video calls directly from your editor and codeshare to see each others cursors.

Agnostic. Edit together simultaneously, interoperable between VS Code and all JetBrains IDEs.



Supported platforms

  • Interoperable between VS Code and all JetBrains IDEs
  • Supported services: GitHub, GitLab, GitLab Self Hosted, Bitbucket & Azure DevOps

Want to learn more?

Check out blog.git.live for the latest updates
notes:
12.0.2

Fixed selecting issue in issue selector does not do anything


12.0.1

Fixed multiple issue causing uncaught exceptions

Fixed issue with following not working on certain open files

Improved calling notifications

Fixed pixelated avatars when calling


12.0.0

New feature: Voice and video calling with screen & code share!

  • Make one-to-one calls directly from your editor
  • Screenshare any window or desktop
  • Codeshare to see each others cursors and edit together simultaneously
  • Interoperable between VS Code and all JetBrains IDEs

NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.


11.1.2

Fixed issue with following user whilst collaborating


11.1.1

Removed requirement for read access to code via API when installing GitLive on your repository hosting service

Fixed not all services showing in add account in plugin settings


11.1.0

Global setting to hide gutter conflicts

Added fix for gutter popup being stale

Fixed bug with excessive new line on the gutter preview

Fixed issue with gutter icons refreshing excessively

Fixed issue where conflict markers cover an additional line


11.0.0

New feature: Instant merge conflict detection!

  • See other contributor's changes to a file in the gutter of your editor, updated in real-time
  • Conflicts between their version and yours are shown in red
  • Click the change in the gutter to popup the other contributor's branch and connected issue
  • Cherry pick their change from the popup straight into your local file

Other notable changes

  • Remove your local copy from GitLive via the context menu
  • Fixed synchronization issue whilst collaborating

NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.


10.0.5

Fixed issues with custom GitLab self hosted urls

Fixed cherry-pick failure on 2020.3


10.0.4

Fixed an issue causing an uncaught exception


10.0.3

Fixed issues with remote url containing www


10.0.2

Fixed issues with custom GitLab self hosted urls


10.0.1

Fixed Gitlab self hosted with remotes using ssh


10.0.0

This update brings GitLab Self Hosted support!


Once installed, open a repository from your GitLab self-hosted instance in your IDE to get started.


NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.


9.0.0

New feature: Issue tracking

  • The GitLive window now shows which issue each of your teammates' are working on in realtime
  • Share your current issue with your team by selecting an issue to work on
  • See your current issue in the status bar and click to select a new issue
  • Selecting a new issue to work on automatically creates a new branch

8.0.1

Fixed possible synchronization issue whilst collaborating


8.0.0

Improved the stability of real-time editing, in particular when collaborating across JetBrains & VSCode


NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.


7.1.0

New feature: Cherry pick a teammate's changes directly from their local files! Just right-click their working copy or even just a file in the GitLive window and select Cherry-Pick...


Added support for connecting to Azure DevOps via SSH and remote URLs using the old domain visualstudio.com


Fixed possible synchronization issue whilst collaborating


7.0.0

Fixed several uncaught exceptions showing in IDE including Permission denied, INTERNAL and NoClassDefFoundError


NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.


6.2.0

GitHub.com users: You can now use GitLive without having to install the GitLive App on your GitHub organisation! Just make sure your GitHub account is setup correctly in the IDE under Settings -> Version Control -> GitHub


Fixed more synchronization bugs whilst collaborating, including following getting switched off when changing files


Fixed an issue where file changes from unpushed commits would not appear in GitLive


6.1.0

Added remote cursor position indicators in right hand gutter


Cursor following now works whilst using the debugger


Fixed issue with sign in on 2020.2 IDEs


Fixed possible synchronization issues whilst collaborating


6.0.1

Welcome to GitLive, the new name for TeamHub, this release upgrades our watch feature to full real-time editing! To work on a teammate's files right click their name in the Team Window and select "Collaborate on their files"


Other changes include:


New look TeamHub window with inline diff view


Follow/Unfollow your teammates cursor option when collaborating


New settings for offline mode, hide activity graph, hide working copy changes


New accounts list in settings to view and manage connected repository hosting service accounts


Support for Azure DevOps cloud


Support for 2020 IDEs


NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.


5.0.4

Fixed Bitbucket installation link


5.0.3

Fixed issues with offline, away & online state changes


5.0.1

Added support for 2019.3 IDEs


Introducing Incognito Mode


When enabled your teammates cannot view your local changes and will only get notified of potential merge conflicts with your changes once they are pushed. Incognito Mode was designed for when you are working on a spike or experimental change to avoid teammates being needlessly notified about potential merge conflicts with your work in progress.


Support for watching across projects


Prior to this update you could only watch teammates if you had the same project open in your IDE, now you can watch a teammate from any project that contains a repository from the same organization


NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.


4.0.3

Fixed race condition that could cause sign in to fail


4.0.2

Restored compatibility with 2018 IDEs


4.0.1

This update brings GitLab support!


Once installed, open a repository from GitLab in your IDE to get started.


NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.


3.0.1

This update brings Bitbucket support, once installed, open a repository from Bitbucket in your IDE to get started.


It also includes an important fix for an issue affecting IDEs 2019.2 and later, where teammates files were not being updated so make sure you upgrade if you are using the 2019.2+


NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.


2.0.2

Restored Android Studio compatibility


2.0.1

You can now "watch" your teammates, to watch make sure you have the same repository open as the teammate you want to watch, then right click them in the team window and select watch.


Watching a teammate will open their current file and show their caret, updating in real-time as they type, scroll and select text. If they change files the new file will automatically open in your IDE also.


Please note currently you cannot edit their files but this feature will be available in a future update coming soon.


NOTE: As this is a major version update make sure your whole team upgrades, all team members need to use the same major version of the plugin otherwise you may find some features do not work correctly.
